item.title: setting up blogdown
item.description: Needing a site redesign, I spent several weeks fiddling with skeleton and, later, Foundation off and on. There just weren’t enough hours in the day. Then, I spotted the following tweet from Julia Silge. This prompted the following git commit from me: Now, just over a week later, I’ve got a site! Who would have thought web design could be done mostly in R? I won’t give a thorough walkthrough; thankfully, this has been beautifully covered by Amber Thomas here, and she and Yihui Xie are currently working on a web-book here.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

Travis Gerke 12902 Magnolia Drive MRC-219 Tampa, FL 33612 United States +1 813 745-6448 travisgerke@gmail.com    Link to full CV Education Sc.D. in Epidemiology Harvard School of Public Health Boston, MA 2014 A.M. in Biostatistics Harvard University Cambridge, MA 2011 B.A. in Mathematics University of Florida Gainesville, FL 2009 B.
